Though it possesses a pair of adequately-developed wings, it is rarely seen flying in a traditional sense. It is in fact more prone to gliding from location to location. It has a powerful set of lungs which gives it the ability to produce extremely loud, concussive roars which can physically damage nearby objects. The Tigrex relies on its sheer brute strength to bring down opponents.

When idle, Tigrex will assume a bipedal gait, standing only upon its hind legs while holding its forelimbs at its side. When threatened or engaging prey, however, it will stand upon all fours and ready itself for combat. It will usually attempt to intimidate would-be attackers with an ear-splitting roar. The Tigrex can be found in many different environments. If combat becomes intense enough, it will flush blood to its forelimbs, face, and eyes, in order to give its skin a bright-red glow as an effort to further intimidate attackers. Like many wyverns, it will travel far and wide in search of prey.

items.name: Tigrex Scale
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Survival} checks when tracking a creature while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tigrex Claw
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} Terwijl je bent afgestemd op dit pantser, kun je elk consumptieartikel, zoals een drankje of voedsel, gebruiken als een bonusactie; zolang jij degene bent die het consumeert.

items.name: Tigrex Carapace
entries: {@i Marathon Runner+.} Terwijl je dit pantser draagt, verhoogt je loopsnelheid met 10 voet en negeer je moeilijk begaanbaar terrein als het niet door een magisch effect werd gecreëerd.

items.name: Tigrex Tail
entries: Je hebt weerstand tegen koude schade terwijl je dit harnas draagt.

items.name: Tigrex Fang
entries: {@i Tranquilizing Guru.} While you wear this armor, you are able to detect when a monster is weakened enough to be captured.

items.name: Tigrex Scalp
entries: Je bent immuun voor vuurschade als je dit harnas draagt.

items.name: Tigrex Scale
entries: Je wapen brengt een extra 1d8 schade toe.

items.name: Tigrex Claw
entries: You have advantage on death saving throws while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Tigrex Carapace
entries: {@i Earplugs.} Terwijl je op dit wapen bent afgestemd, kun je een bonusactie gebruiken om twee oordoppen in een vorm naar keuze te toveren. Terwijl je deze oordopjes gebruikt, word je beschouwd als {@condition deafened} en heb je voordeel op saving throws tegen donderschade. Je kunt de oordopjes als bonusactie verdrijven, waardoor het doofheidseffect eindigt.

items.name: Tigrex Tail
entries: {@i Strong Attack.} Wanneer je een wezen raakt met dit wapen kan je je bonus actie gebruiken om het wezen 10 voet achteruit te duwen.

items.name: Tigrex Fang
entries: {@i Mind's Eye.} Je aanvallen met dit wapen omzeilen de schadeweerstand van elk wezen.

items.name: Tigrex Scalp
entries: Je wapen brengt een extra 1d10 schade toe.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Alle Tigrex materialen zijn vervloekt. Als je je aanpast aan het harnas of wapen waarin het materiaal is verwerkt, breidt de vloek zich uit naar jou. Zolang je vervloekt blijft, onderga je de volgende effecten:

items: U wilt het wapen of harnas niet afstaan en houdt het altijd binnen handbereik.
Je hebt nadeel op aanvalsrollen met andere wapens dan dit wapen, tenzij er geen vijand binnen 60 voet van je is die je kunt zien of horen.

Telkens wanneer een vijandig wezen schade toebrengt, moet je slagen op een {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw of je wordt berserk. De DC verhoogt met 1 voor elk extra tigrex materiaal dat in je harnas of wapen wordt gestopt. Terwijl je berserk bent, moet je elke ronde je actie gebruiken om het wezen dat zich het dichtst bij je bevindt aan te vallen met je wapen. Als je extra aanvallen kunt doen als onderdeel van de aanvalsactie, gebruik je die extra aanvallen, waarbij je het eerstvolgende dichtstbijzijnde wezen aanvalt nadat je je huidige doelwit hebt gedood. Als je meerdere mogelijke doelwitten hebt, val je er een willekeurig aan. Je bent berserk tot je aan het begin van je beurt geen wezens binnen 60 voet van je kunt zien of horen.

trait.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While it has 62 hit points or fewer, the tobi-kadachi has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tobi-kadachi's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Gliding
entries: The tobi-kadachi has a gliding speed of 60 feet. When the tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tobi-kadachi makes three attacks. two with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

Tobi-Kadachi's face resembles a colubrid in appearance with grayish blue scales covering its slim squirrel-like shape. On its back are patches of white fur as well as a bushy tail covered in rows of spikes. Its front limbs also have a few spikes.

As Tobi-Kadachi fights, it picks up static electricity in its fur by brushing against trees and the ground. Tobi-Kadachi uses this static electricity to increase the strength of its attacks. Like a flying squirrel, Tobi-Kadachi has a membrane between its limbs that allow it to glide for long distances.

Tobi-Kadachis are arboreal predators that use their mobility and static electricity to pursue and pounce on prey such as {@creature mosswine|MHMM}s, {@creature vespoid|MHMM}s, both forest and woodland pteryxs, and rarely, {@creature jagras|MHMM}.

Tobi-Kadachis compete with other large monsters, such as {@creature Rathalos|MHMM} and {@creature Anjanath|MHMM}, for both prey and territory, with the Fanged Wyverns often being overpowered by the aforementioned species.

Tobi-Kadachi are normally quite reclusive, preferring to skulk in the darker, more tangled regions of the Ancient Forest. If angered however, they can become quite dangerous, and caution is advised when dealing with them.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Pelt
entries: You can don or doff your armor as an action, while you are attuned to this armor.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Scale
entries: Je hebt een +3 bonus op {@skill Acrobatics} controles terwijl je dit harnas draagt.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Membrane
entries: When you place this material into your armor it gains a gliding membrane, which extends from your forearms to your hindlegs. As an action or reaction, you can extend your arms to reduce your fall speed to 10 feet per round while traveling in a forward motion until you reach the ground, you are {@condition grappled}, or you use your action to end the effect early. If you are falling straight down, you may choose the direction you travel when you begin your glide. Once used, you can't use this property again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Claw
entries: {@i Jump Master+.} While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell jump} spell from it as a bonus action at will, but can target only yourself when you do so.

items.name: Tobi Electro Sac
entries: While wearing this armor, your walking speed becomes 30 feet, unless your walking speed is higher, and your speed isn't reduced if you are encumbered or wearing heavy armor. In addition, you can jump three times the normal distance, though you can't jump farther than your remaining movement would allow.

items.name: Kadachi Gem
entries: {@i Evade Extender (S).} You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Pelt
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to have this weapon to return to your hand so long as it is within 200 feet of you.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Claw
entries: Your lightning spells deal an extra 1d4 lightning damage.

items.name: Tobi Electro Sac
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d4 lightning damage.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: Zeldzaam materiaal om het pantser te verbeteren.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tobi-kadachi's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Gliding
entries: When the tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tobi-kadachi makes three attacks: two with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doelwit. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

As Tobi-Kadachi fights, it picks up static electricity in its fur by brushing against trees and the ground. Tobi-Kadachi uses this static electricity to increase the strength of its attacks. Like a flying squirrel, Tobi-Kadachi has a membrane between its limbs that allow it to glide for long distances.

Tobi-Kadachis are arboreal predators that use their mobility and static electricity to pursue and pounce on prey such as {@creature mosswine|MHMM}s, {@creature vespoid|MHMM}s, both forest and woodland pteryxs, and rarely, {@creature jagras|MHMM}.

Tobi-Kadachis compete with other large monsters, such as {@creature Rathalos|MHMM} and {@creature Anjanath|MHMM}, for both prey and territory, with the Fanged Wyverns often being overpowered by the aforementioned species.

Tobi-Kadachi are normally quite reclusive, preferring to skulk in the darker, more tangled regions of the Ancient Forest. If angered however, they can become quite dangerous, and caution is advised when dealing with them.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Pelt
entries: You have a +1 bonus to {@skill Acrobatics} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Scale
entries: During a short or long rest you can spend your time crafting a bug zapper. When you fail a check to capture an {@table insects|AGMH|insect}, you can use the bug zapper to succeed instead.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Membrane
entries: When you place this material into your armor it gains a gliding membrane, which extends from your forearms to your hindlegs. As an action or reaction, you can extend your arms to slow your descent to 30 feet until the end of the round. If you land before the round ends, you take no falling damage and land on your feet. Once used, you can't use this property again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Claw
entries: {@i Jump Master.} While wearing this armor, you can use an action to double your jump distance. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses on a short or long rest.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Pelt
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to have this weapon to return to your hand so long as it is within 60 feet of you.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Scale
entries: Als je een spreuk doet die bliksemschade veroorzaakt, voeg dan 1/2 van je vaardigheidsbonus toe aan die schade.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Membrane
entries: When you touch this weapon to a liquid, you know if it is poisonous or if there is poison in it. If it is poison you also identify the name of the poison (if it has one) and its effects. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Sm Monster Bone
entries: Uncommon armor upgrade materiaal.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the tzitzi-ya-ku moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a talon Attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the tzitzi-ya-ku can make one tail Attack against it as a Bonus Action.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku makes two attacks: one bite attack and one with its talon.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Flash {@recharge 5}
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku emits a bright flash of light from the fins on its head in a 60 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Talon
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku makes one Talon attack.

Tzitzi-Ya-Ku is a theropod of a navy blue coloration. It has long, powerful back legs, and muscular forelegs complete with three claws for grasping prey. Perhaps its most unique feature is the pair of retractable frills that line either side of its head, which are bright and vividly colorful in appearance. Its back is lined with a row of short spines, and it has wide, sturdy feet.

Tzitzi-Ya-Ku is able to emit bright flashes of light from the fins on the sides of its head. This can be used to disorient attackers and prey alike, allowing the monster to gain the upper hand in combat. Its powerful hind legs can be used to deliver potent kicks during battle.

This monster is comparatively low on the food chain, so it uses the dark colouration of its body to blend in and stalk its prey amongst the shadowy undergrowth of the Coral Highlands, far below the jurisdiction of the powerful Wyverns that rule the local ecosystem.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Scale
entries: This armor is 10% lighter than normal armor of this type. If it has a Strength requirement to use, it is reduced by 1.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Hide
entries: Je hebt een +2 bonus op {@skill Sleight of Hand} controles terwijl je dit harnas draagt.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Claw
entries: You cannot become intoxicated while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Photophore
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition stunned} condition, {@condition unconscious} condition, or other sleep-like effects; you do so with a +2 bonus.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Gem
entries: While wearing this armor, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Scale
entries: Your eyes glow red while you are touching your weapon.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Hide
entries: While you hold this weapon, you can use an action to speak this weapon's command word to ignite the magic in it, causing it to flare brilliantly. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of you that can see you, must use their reaction to shield their eyes or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Claw
entries: Als je een spreuk doet die bliksemschade veroorzaakt, voeg dan 1/2 van je vaardigheidsbonus toe aan die schade.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Photophore
entries: This weapon has 3 runes. When you hit a creature, you can expend 1 of its runes to have the target make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. This weapon regains 1 expended rune daily at dawn.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Gem
entries: {@i (Druid, Sorcerer, & Wizard only)} While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to cast the {@spell color spray} from it spell once per day, without expending a spell slot.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: Zeldzaam materiaal om het pantser te verbeteren.

items.name: Dash Extract
entries: Materiaal voor {@item mega dash juice|AGMH}.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The ukanlos can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ukanlos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the ukanlos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ukanlos makes three attacks; one with its bite, one with its claw and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}) . Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the ukanlos can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ice Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The ukanlos exhales a stream of ice in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 13d6}) cold damage and is {@condition restrained} by the ice on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one and is not {@condition restrained}.

The {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 18} Strength check, escaping from the ice on a success. The effect ends if the ice is destroyed. The ice has AC 12, 30 hit points, resistance to slashing and piercing damage, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and vulnerable to fire damage.

action.name: Crush
entries: If the ukanlos uses all of its movement to rise up on its hindlegs, it can then use its action to slams its body in an area within 10 feet of its location that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage + 21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) cold damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the ukanlos's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the ukanlos's space.

action.name: Launch
entries: The Ukanlos digs its shovel-like jaw into the ground under a creature or object. If it is a creature, they must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be tossed 40 feet up in the air and 15 feet away from the Ukanlos taking 10 ({@dice 3d6}) upon landing. If there is a creature in the location the target lands, they must make the same saving throw or take the same amount of damage.

legendary.name: Toss
entries: The ukanlos uses its Launch.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The ukanlos makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) Check.

legendary.name: Swim (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ukanlos digs partially under the ground and exposing its razor sharp back and moves up to its burrow speed, during this move it may move through other creatures. Any creatures the ukanlos moves through must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 20 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

A mysterious wyvern said only to appear after large avalanches deep in the snowy mountains. Often seen crushing ice balls and rock into powder in its stride, it's known to most as Ukanlos, although there are whisperings it may be the white god... Ukanlos is a Flying Wyvern that is closely related to the {@creature Akantor|MHMM}. Originally, like Akantor, Ukanlos was classified as a Elder Dragon due to it not fitting in any other class but after much research it has been found to be a large species of Flying Wyvern.

Ukanlos are apex predators that can virtually feed on anything they'd want. Animals like {@creature Popo|MHMM}, {@creature Bulldrome|MHMM}, and {@creature Anteka|MHMM} are common prey. However being indiscriminate feeders Ukanlos will also prey on other predators such as {@creature Tigrex|MHMM}, {@creature Barioth|MHMM}, {@creature Khezu|MHMM}, {@creature Blangonga|MHMM}, Abiorugu, Doragyurosu, {@creature Deviljho|MHMM} and even Elder Dragons such as {@creature Kirin|MHMM} or {@creature Kushala Daora|MHMM} are fair game for these behemoths. Ukanlos will also eat the ice and absorb minerals, however this beast is rather large so the amount of ice it would have to eat would be huge.

Ukanlos closely resembles Akantor in body structure and possesses the same quadrupedal gait. It has a silvery-white carapace which features a row of large, jagged fins along its back. It has a small, compact face which features glowing yellow eyes, sharp teeth, and a massive, shovel-like jaw. Its massive serrated shovel-like jaw allows it to fling up large chunks of ice and to dig through the ice with ease. Ukanlos has grown an extremely tough and streamlined carapace with large razor sharp fins running along its spine to "swim" though the ice.

The Ukanlos can produce an ice beam from its mouth to attack anything foolish enough to attempt to harm it, and is known to use its heavy body weight to crush opponents and its jaws are capable of crushing ice and rock alike. Despite its great size and weight, Ukanlos is known to be able to leap significant distances. In order to survive the weather this creature may have a large layer of fat underneath its hard shell. This layer of flesh is visible underneath its forearms, showing a light-blue underflesh. This beast also hibernate for vast periods of time to survive after feeding.

Ukanlos lives a solitary life, and has only ever been encountered in remote, frozen regions. It is fiercely territorial to any who intrude upon its land. Ukanlos have been found to attack and destroy villages that are built in its territory after waking from hibernation.

items.name: Ukanlos Carapace
entries: You can conjure a {@item Decanter of Endless Water|DMG} (DMG 161) at will while you are attuned to this armor, but if it leaves your hands, it vanishes into thin air.

items.name: Ukanlos Underscale
entries: {@i Tremor-Proof.} U kunt niet worden gestoten {@condition prone} terwijl u dit pantser draagt.

items.name: Ukanlos Digger
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell move earth} spell. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Ukanlos Fin
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight while you wear this armor.

items.name: Ukanlos Tail
entries: You can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground while you wear this armor.

items.name: Ukanlos Shoveljaw
entries: You have an emblem of water pouring out of a bowl on your armor. You can use an action to speak the armor's command word and summon a {@creature water elemental}, as if you had cast the {@spell conjure elemental} spell. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Ukanlos Gem
entries: Je bent immuun voor koude schade als je dit harnas draagt.

items.name: Ukanlos Carapace
entries: {@i Quick Load.} Je kunt herladen als een vrije actie terwijl je op dit wapen bent afgestemd.

items.name: Ukanlos Underscale
entries: Your cold spells ignore a creature's resistance to cold damage while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Ukanlos Digger
entries: {@i (Bow only)} Whenever you apply a coating to your arrows, you can coat up to 5 more.

items.name: Ukanlos Fin
entries: Terwijl je dit wapen vasthoudt, kun je een actie gebruiken om een kakofonisch gebrul te laten horen. Elk wezen in een straal van 15 voet dat jou als vijand beschouwt, moet een {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw doen. Als je niet slaagt, wordt het schepsel {@condition frightened} van je voor 1 minuut. Een wezen kan deze worp herhalen aan het eind van elke beurt, en het effect op zichzelf beëindigen als het slaagt. Als de worp van een wezen succesvol is of het effect eindigt voor het wezen, is het wezen immuun voor dit effect voor 24 uur.

items.name: Ukanlos Tail
entries: You gain a + 2 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC while attuned to this weapon. This bonus increases to +4 when the spell you are casting deals cold damage, such as {@spell ice knife|XGE} or {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm|XGE} spells.

items.name: Ukanlos Shoveljaw
entries: {@i (Sorcerer & Wizard only)} This weapon has 10 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell ice knife|XGE} (1 rune), {@spell ice storm} (4 runes), or {@spell wall of ice} (4 runes). The weapon regains 1d6 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: Ukanlos Gem
entries: Terwijl je op dit wapen bent afgestemd, richten je koude spreuken volledige schade aan bij een wezen dat weerstand heeft tegen koude schade en halve schade bij een wezen dat immuniteit heeft tegen koude schade.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Uragaan makes one tail attack and two chin slam attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chin Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Roll {@recharge 5}
entries: The uragaan rolls its body into a wheel and moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures the Uragaan moves through must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Emit Flames
entries: (2/per Long rest). The uragaan releases a wave of fire from its underside in a 10-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage and catches fire on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and does not catch fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Uragaan is covered in a lustrous gold-colored hide. Its back is lined with hard crystals and its chin is plated with a rock-like shell, suggesting the Uragaan has evolved a tough exterior due to life in volcanic regions. Its underbelly is covered in a sticky, tar-like substance which it uses to affix explosive rocks to itself.

Uragaan's signature ability is to roll its body into a wheel to increase its speed and agility. The growths on their back stable this rolling ability. It will do this often in an attempt to crush the adventurer. Uragaan create a very effective weapon in the form of its chin by melting minerals and attaching them with lava, which it can use for breaking up rocks. The chin also evens its center of gravity so its legs can compensate for its heavy body. In a group of Uragaan, the one with the largest chin has the highest status among the group.

Uragaan is something of oddity in the food chain - it has almost no natural predators, but is not particularly predatory itself and has no competitors, preferring to consume vast amounts of plants and rock. The rocks that it feeds on are surprisingly nutrient rich, and its rock-hard lower jaw is perfectly designed to break them up, although it does make them awkward to swallow.

items.name: Uragaan Carapace
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to lightning or thunder damage (your choice) until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: U.Firecell Stone
entries: {@i Shield.} While you are attuned to this armor and you use a reaction that would increase your AC, you gain an additional +1 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Uragaan Scute
entries: {@i Guard.} Je kan niet geduwd of achterover geslagen worden terwijl je dit harnas draagt.

items.name: Flame Sac
entries: Terwijl je bent afgestemd op dit pantser, kun je een bonusactie gebruiken om het commando woord te spreken en vuur uit te ademen naar een doelwit binnen 15 meter van je. Het doelwit moet een {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw doen, waarbij het {@damage 3d6} vuurschade oploopt als het niet slaagt, of half zoveel als het wel slaagt.
Once used, this property cannot be used again until you finish a long rest

items.name: Uragaan Marrow
entries: {@i Negate Bleeding.} Je bent immuun voor verwondingseffecten, zoals de {@creature Odogaron|MHMM}'s bloedige wond of de {@creature bearded devil}'s helse wond terwijl je dit pantser draagt.

items.name: Uragaan Ruby
entries: {@i Uragaan Protection.} When you must make a saving throw while taking the {@action dodge} action, you can use your Armor Class in place of making the roll. You can use this property three times, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Uragaan Carapace
entries: {@i Sharpening.} During a short or long rest you can spend your time sharpening a bladed weapon. When you hit a creature for the first time after sharpening it, the weapon deals its maximum piercing or slashing damage to the target.

items.name: Uragaan Scale
entries: {@i Carver.} You have advantage on your first carve attempt on a creature while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: U.Firecell Stone
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon you can use an action to conjure a {@item alchemist's fire (flask)|PHB|flask of alchemist's fire} once a day. If unused for 24 hours, the flask returns to whence it came, where that is, who knows?

items.name: Uragaan Scute
entries: {@i Partbreaker.} You deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage when you critically hit with this weapon.

items.name: Flame Sac
entries: When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, it deals an extra {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

items.name: Uragaan Jaw
entries: {@i (Bowgun only) Spread up.} When you hit a creature with {@filter spread ammo|items|source=AGMH|search=spread} and they are within half your normal bowgun range, increase the damage die size by 1.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Fire Spit
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60/100 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) fire damage.

Leviathans that inhabit volcanoes. Noted for swarming around larger monsters' kills in order to feed. Uroktor rarely hunt for themselves, but are known for being highly aggressive. Just like their adult form, the {@creature Agnaktor|MHMM}, they have the remarkable ability to tunnel through solid volcanic rock. Uroktor are distinguished by their reddish-purple skin, which protects them from both the sweltering heat and volcanic predators. Uroktor will defend themselves from other monsters and adventurers alike, but will flee if they feel over-whelmed.

items.name: Uroktor Scale
entries: Wisps of harmless, odorless smoke rise from this armor while it is worn.

items.name: Uroktor Scale
entries: As a bonus action, you can speak this weapon's command word, causing it to shed bright light in a 20 foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: Uncommon armor upgrade materiaal.

items.name: Dragonfell Berry
entries: Can be eaten as a ration.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Als de vaal hazak faalt bij een reddingsworp, kan hij kiezen om te slagen.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: De vaal hazak heeft voordeel op saving throws tegen spreuken en andere magische effecten.

trait.name: Effluvium Aura
entries: At the start of each of the vaal hazak's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. A creature that touches the vaal hazak or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: De vaal hazak krijgt 30 hit points terug aan het begin van zijn beurt als hij ten minste 1 hit point heeft. Als de vaal hazak stralingsschade of schade van {@item holy water (flask)|PHB|holy water} oploopt, werkt deze eigenschap niet aan het begin van de volgende beurt van de vaal hazak.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: De vaal hazak doet vier aanvallen: twee met zijn beet en twee met zijn klauwen.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Effluvium Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The vaal hazak exhales a cloud of effluvium bacteria in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) necrotic damage and are cursed as if by the {@spell bestow curse} spell for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one and are not cursed.

action.name: Return from the Dead (3/day)
entries: The vaal hazak raises a recently deceased CR 6 or lower creature from the dead to fight by its side. A creature raised in this way is considered undead, heals to its hit point maximum and gains the undead fortitude trait.
Presented for reference, the {@creature zombie}'s {@b Undead Fortitude} trait:

{@i If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.}

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: De vaal hazak doet een staart aanval.

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vaal hazak fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the vaal hazak's gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each living creature within 20 feet of the vaal hazak must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 38 ({@damage 11d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Vaal Hazak is a dragon that appears to have long sickle-like claws on each finger. Its face has long, sinewy features that look like decaying tissue. When it flaps its wings, it appears to stir up toxic clouds, possibly exuding the Effluvium bacteria found in the Rotten Vale. It is shown to have a mottled maroon hide with a rather dull greenish-gray underbelly. Its wings are also sinewy—looking like spider webs when outstretched.

Vaal Hazak appears to consume the life force of other wildlife nearby in the form of a grayish ash-like fog that trails from the victim back to patches on Vaal Hazak's body. It has also demonstrated necromancer-like abilities, bringing {@creature Girros|MHMM} corpses back to life as allies. The ash-fog it exudes limits the maximum life of Hunters in contact with it.

Another interesting adaptation of the monster is the unnerving structure of its head, which sports two jaws. The larger outer jaw is used as a means of clamping down its prey whilst the inner is used to force the prey into its throat where the monster can use the effluvium to breakdown the prey as it consumes it. The unnatural anatomy allows the monster to better use its effluvium for regular consumption of prey, portraying how the monster's anatomy has potentially adapted to the bond it has with the naturally occurring miasma.
Vaal Hazak is aggressive the instant it feels threatened and will attempted to use its power over the effluvium to defeat its opponent.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Carapace
entries: {@i Effluvia Resis+.} Als je dit pantser draagt, ben je immuun voor schade door Effluvia en heb je weerstand tegen zuurschade.

items.name: Deceased Scale
entries: Terwijl je dit pantser draagt, krijg je elke 10 minuten 1d6 Hit Points terug, op voorwaarde dat je minstens 1 hit point hebt. Als je een lichaamsdeel verliest, zorgt het pantser ervoor dat het ontbrekende deel weer aangroeit en weer volledig functioneert na 1d6 + 1 dagen als je de hele tijd minstens 1 hit point hebt.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Wing
entries: {@i Recovery Up+.} Je krijgt het maximum aantal hit points terug dat je kunt krijgen van potions of {@table plants|AGMH} die je consumeert.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Membrane
entries: While wearing this armor you can speak its command word to release effluvium gas in a 5-foot radius around you for 1 minute. At the start of each of your turns, each creature within 5 feet of you takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Tail
entries: Je hebt weerstand tegen koude schade terwijl je dit harnas draagt.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Gem
entries: {@i Poison Absorption.} Telkens wanneer je aan gifschade wordt blootgesteld, neem je geen schade op en krijg je in plaats daarvan een aantal hit points terug dat gelijk is aan de helft van de opgelopen gifschade.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Carapace
entries: {@i Elderseal.} Een wezen dat door dit wapen is geraakt, kan tot het begin van je volgende beurt geen actie gebruiken die een herlaadbeurt heeft. Het wezen kan aan het eind van zijn beurt nog steeds rollen om zijn actie te herladen.

items.name: Deceased Scale
entries: {@i Peak Performance.} Als je hit points vol zijn en je gooit een 1 of een 2 op een dobbelsteen voor een aanval die je doet met een mêlee-wapen, kun je de dobbelsteen opnieuw gooien en moet je de nieuwe worp gebruiken, zelfs als de nieuwe worp een 1 of een 2 is.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Talon
entries: Je wapen brengt een extra {@damage 1d10} necrotische schade toe.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Fang
entries: This weapon has 3 runes which are regained daily at dawn. Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you can expend a rune to have the target make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. A creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a successful save.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Wing
entries: Je krijgt een +3 bonus op je spell attack rolls en spell save DC terwijl je afgestemd bent op dit wapen. Deze bonus stijgt tot +4 als de spreuk die je uitspreekt necrotische schade veroorzaakt.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Membrane
entries: {@i (Bow only & Requires 3 sockets)} When you nock an arrow on this bow, it whispers in Elvish, "Return to that which spawned you" When you use this weapon to make a ranged attack, you can, as a command phrase, say "To one with life" The target of your attack becomes your sworn enemy until it dies or until dawn seven days later. You can have only one such sworn enemy at a time. When your sworn enemy dies, you can choose a new one after the next dawn.

When you make a ranged attack roll with this weapon against your sworn enemy, you have advantage on the roll. In addition, your target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover, and you suffer no disadvantage due to long range. If the attack hits, your sworn enemy takes an extra 3d6 piercing damage.
While your sworn enemy lives, you have disadvantage on attack rolls with all other weapons.

items.name: Vaal Hazak Gem
entries: {@i (Cleric only)} The weapon has 10 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell animate dead} (3 runes). {@spell bestow curse} (3 runes), {@spell contagion} (5 runes), or {@spell raise dead} (10 runes).
Het wapen krijgt dagelijks bij dageraad 1d6 + 4 verbruikte runen terug. Als je de laatste runen hebt verbruikt, gooi dan een d20. Bij een 1 kan het wapen een week lang geen runen herwinnen.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Elke zeldzaamheid wapen upgrade materiaal.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Elke zeldzaamheid armor upgrade materiaal.

trait.name: Brutal Wings
entries: The valstrax deals one extra die of its damage when the valstrax hits with its wing attack (included in the attack).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: Als de valstrax faalt in een reddingsworp, kan hij kiezen om te slagen.

trait.name: The Red Comet
entries: De valstrax lokt geen gelegenheidsaanvallen uit als hij de {@action Dash} actie uitvoert.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The valstrax makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claw, and two with its wing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dragonbolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Ignition {@recharge 5}
entries: The valstrax spread its wings out around itself and ignites them. Fire spreads out from the wings in a 20-foot radius around the valstrax. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 40 ({@damage 9d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: De valstrax doet een Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) Check.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The valstrax makes a firebolt attack.

legendary.name: Dragon Rush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The valstrax moves up to half its fly speed in a straight line, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures the valstrax moves through must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) slashing damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and are knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

Valstrax is a slender Elder Dragon covered in gleaming silver scales. Its most notable feature is its wings, which have fused into a trident-like structure. Its back is lined with fin-like projections. Its head has a small crest and its eyes are blue.

Valstrax is covered in reflective silver scales that give this monster its slim appearance. Like most other Elder Dragons, valstrax has six limbs: four legs and a pair of wings. Unique to valstrax are its trident shaped wings. The wings of the valstrax are versatile and flexible being able to stretch the arm appendages to hit far-reaching targets, expanding its wings resembling a three-fingered claw for wider area of attack or closing the wings to make use of the blade-like tip on the frontal end of the wings that is commonly used with the stretching appendages as "jabs" akin to that of a spear for accurate attacks. On the ends of both of the wings are three openings that fire off energy produced via a special organ in its chest that sucks in the air before releasing it out through the wings as a form exhaust. This allows it to fly at outrageous speeds, making it the fastest flying monster known today. When flying at high speeds, it looks like a "red comet" in the sky, showing that at its highest speed no one can identify it easily.

Valstrax can also flip its wings in two different directions: Backwards; for flying at high speeds, and Forward; attacking foes from a distance by using the energy as projectiles. valstrax's breathing methods are nearly identical to birds in a sense. The special organ in its chest is constantly glowing red and occasionally pulses whenever valstrax decides to use it for certain actions, such as flying.

Valstrax are quite calm when not disturbed, but will turn extremely aggressive if they feel threatened in anyway. No matter the foe, valstrax have a variety of ways of fighting off threats. This is the reason why it is sometimes called the Silver Wing of the Evil Star or Sky Comet Dragon. Though valstrax are quite calm in the sky, they occasionally will mistakenly crash into objects in the air from their shocking flying speeds. These objects can be about the size of an Airship or even a Flying Wyvern.

items.name: Valstrax Shard
entries: {@i Marathon Runner+.} Terwijl je dit pantser draagt, verhoogt je loopsnelheid met 10 voet en negeer je moeilijk begaanbaar terrein als het niet door een magisch effect werd gecreëerd.

items.name: Valstrax Hardclaw
entries: While you wear this armor, you can use a bonus action and click the armor's boots' heels together. If you do, your walking speed doubles, and any creature that makes an opportunity attack against you has disadvantage on the attack roll. If you click your heels together again, you end the effect.
When the armors' property has been used for a total of 10 minutes, the magic ceases to function until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Valstrax Cortex
entries: Als je dit harnas draagt, kost moeilijk terrein je geen extra beweging. Bovendien kan magie uw snelheid niet verminderen en u ook niet {@condition paralyzed} of {@condition restrained}.

items.name: Shimmering Dragonfluid
entries: While wearing this armor you can use an action to speak its command word. This causes a pair of metallic dragon wings to appear on your back for 1 hour or until you repeat the command word as an action. The wings give you a flying speed of 60 feet. When they disappear, you can't use them again for 1d12 hours.

items.name: Valstrax Helixtail
entries: You have immunity to necrotic damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Ruby Dragon Mindstone
entries: {@i Dragonheart.} Wanneer je onder de helft van je maximale aantal hit points komt, krijg je gedurende 1 minuut de conditie {@condition dragonblight|MHMM}. Terwijl je getroffen bent door dragonblight, heb je weerstand tegen koude, vuur, bliksem, en necrotische schade.

items.name: Valstrax Shard
entries: {@i (spellcaster only)} You know the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip while attuned to this weapon. If you already know it, you gain a +1 bonus to its spell attack roll.

items.name: Valstrax Hardclaw
entries: Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

items.name: Valstrax Cortex
entries: {@i Elderseal.} Een wezen dat door dit wapen is geraakt, kan tot het begin van je volgende beurt geen actie gebruiken die een herlaadbeurt heeft. Het wezen kan aan het eind van zijn beurt nog steeds rollen om zijn actie te herladen.

items.name: Shimmering Dragonfluid
entries: {@i Crisis+.} While suffering from an abnormal status effect, such as {@condition poisoned}, burning, slowed, {@condition blinded}, etc, all attacks and spells deal an extra {@damage 1d12} spell or weapon damage.

items.name: Valstrax Helixtail
entries: Dit wapen heeft 3 runen die dagelijks bij zonsopgang worden herwonnen. Eenmaal per beurt, wanneer je een wezen met dit wapen raakt, kun je een rune gebruiken om het doelwit een {@dc 17} Wijsheidspoging te laten doen of {@condition frightened} van jou te worden gedurende 1 minuut. Een schepsel mag aan het eind van zijn beurt zijn reddingsworp herhalen, waarbij het effect eindigt bij een succesvolle redding.

items.name: Ruby Dragon Mindstone
entries: Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} piercing damage.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Elke zeldzaamheid wapen upgrade materiaal.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Elke zeldzaamheid armor upgrade materiaal.

trait.name: Rime
entries: An area covered in rime is difficult terrain. Additionally any creature that ends its turn while touching a frost covered area takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage and is {@condition grappled} by the frost (Escape 19).

trait.name: Ice Armor (2/day)
entries: The velkhana can use a bonus action to coat its body in ice, giving it +2 AC for 1 minute, or until it takes 50 points of damage from a single creature on a turn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: De velkhana is in het voordeel bij reddingsslagen tegen spreuken en andere magische effecten.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The velkhana makes three attacks with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: De velkhana gebruikt een van de volgende adem wapens.

items.name: Cold Breath
entries: The velkhana exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. That area is covered in rime for 1 minute and each creature in that line must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Hoarfrost Breath
entries: The velkhana exhales an icy blast of hoarfrost in a 60-foot cone. The area is covered in rime for 1 minute and each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, three 1 foot thick, 10-foot-square walls of ice form within the area and last for 10 minutes. If the wall is formed on a creature's space, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

Each 10-foot section of the wall has 12 AC and 30 hit points, and is vulnerable to fire damage. If damaged to 0 hit points, it leaves a hole filled with freezing air. The first time a creature moves through the air on a turn, it makes a {@dc 21} Constitution save, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The velkhana covers the ground in a 15-foot radius in rime for 1 minute and it beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The velkhana can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Hail Storm (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The velkhana forms four boulder-sized chunks of ice from the water in the air that plummet to the ground at different points within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on each point that it chooses must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one ice chunk is affected only once.

Velkhana is a traditional dragon with the slim, upright body structure of elder Dragons like {@creature kushala daora|MHMM}. Its scales and shell are a unique crystalline blue. Its head has a tiara-like crown of small horns. It summons ice to cover its wings, limbs, and tail. Its thin, lance-like tail is highly flexible and can jab at enemies.

Velkhana beheerst vrijelijk ijs en koude wind, en kan in een oogwenk grote gebieden met ijs bedekken. Hij ademt stralen van onderkoelde vloeistof die monsters onmiddellijk kunnen bevriezen. Wanneer hij in zijn ijspantser is gehuld, vormen zich ijskristallen in de buurt die, wanneer ze door Velkhana's ijsadem worden geraakt, grote spitsen vormen die snel ontploffen. Soms vormen zich kleine ijsplatforms, waar je vanaf kunt springen. Af en toe, als hij woedend is, regenen ijspieken uit wolken dicht bij de grond.

items.name: Crystal Shard
entries: {@i Flinch Free.} Terwijl je dit pantser draagt, kun je niet worden omvergeworpen {@condition prone}, of ongewild worden verplaatst van je huidige locatie op welke manier dan ook.

items.name: Velkhana Cortex
entries: {@i Divine Blessing+2.} When you take damage you are not immune or resistant to, roll a d8 and reduce the damage you take by the number rolled. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Velkhana Lash
entries: While you wear this armor you are immune to the {@condition iceblight|MHMM} disease.

items.name: Velkhana Hardclaw
entries: When a creature that touches or hits you with a melee weapon attack while within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to have it make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is afflicted with {@condition iceblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. A creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. You may use this property a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Velkhana Crownhorn
entries: {@i (Sorcerer, Warlock, & Wizard only)} This armor has two runes that it regains daily at dawn. As an action you can expend one of these runes to cast {@spell armor of agathys} at 4th level from it.

items.name: Velkhana Crystal
entries: Je bent immuun voor koude schade terwijl je dit harnas draagt.

items.name: Crystal Shard
entries: {@i Quick Sheath.} Als je op dit wapen bent afgestemd, kun je het altijd als vrije actie wegleggen, zelfs als je al een wapen hebt getrokken als onderdeel van je bewegingsactie.

items.name: Velkhana Cortex
entries: While attuned to this weapon you can use an action to cast the {@spell wall of ice} spell from it, but it deals no damage and the wall is only 3 feet high.

items.name: Velkhana Lash
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word and exhale ice in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Je kunt deze eigenschap twee keer gebruiken, en alle gebruikte gebruiken herwinnen wanneer je een lange rustperiode beëindigt.

items.name: Velkhana Hardclaw
entries: Your cold spells bypass a creature's resistance to cold damage while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Velkhana Crownhorn
entries: {@i Critical Draw+.} Tijdens de eerste gevechtsronde scoren je mêlee wapenaanvallen een kritieke treffer bij een worp van 15 of hoger.

items.name: Velkhana Crystal
entries: {@i Coalescence.} Whenever you succeed on a saving throw to end a condition, you gain a +1 bonus to your attack rolls and spell save DC, and your weapon or spell attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice) until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Elke zeldzaamheid wapen upgrade materiaal.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Elke zeldzaamheid armor upgrade materiaal.

entries.name: Velkhana Divinity
entries: {@b Set bonus (2):} When you critically hit with a weapon or spell that deals cold damage, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage.
{@b Set bonus (4):} An aura of frost builds when your weapon is sheathed for at least 1 minute. When you draw this weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage for the next 4 rounds.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The velocidrome's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the velocidrome can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the velocidrome jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the velocidrome's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the velocidrome's space.

action.name: Alpha Call (1/day)
entries: The velocidrome calls out for help and 2 ({@dice 1d4}) {@creature velociprey|MHMM} appear to assist it.

The Velocidrome has a large, bright red crest over its blue hide signifies to other {@creature Velociprey|MHMM} that it is fit to be their leader. It is heavily set in its pack mentality and will rarely fight alone. To try to scare away potential predators, Velocidrome have colorful scales that act as warning colors. Velocidrome give orders to the Velociprey while it constantly patrols its territory in search of intruders that have entered it. If an intruder is spotted, the Velocidrome will call for its pack before attacking the threat.

items.name: Velociprey Scale
entries: You have a +1 bonus to {@skill Medicine} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Velocidrome Hide
entries: While wearing your armor it plays appropriate music for whatever situation you're in. Blaring horn sections and drums during combat, that sort of thing.

items.name: Velocidrome Head
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition unconscious} condition or other sleep-like effects, you do so with a +1 bonus.

items.name: Velocidrome Shard
entries: While wearing this armor, you can use an action to cast the {@spell longstrider} spell from it. Once used, you can't use this property again until the next dawn.

items.name: Velocidrome Claw
entries: You can use a bonus action to speak this weapon's command word, and transform your weapon into a walking cane or back to its original form.

items.name: Velocidrome Hide
entries: When you cast a spell that deals thunder damage, add 1/2 of your proficiency bonus to that damage.

items.name: Velocidrome Head
entries: De eerste keer dat je een Carve check doet op een creatuur, doe je dat met voordeel.

items.name: Velocidrome Shard
entries: As an action you can make this weapon shed bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light in another 15 feet. You can use another action to make the weapon stop shedding light.

items.name: Velocidrome Claw
entries: This material can be crafted into a 6 six-sided die ({@dc 10} {@item tinker's tools|PHB} check). When you roll it, you can control which number it rolls.

items.name: Screamer Sac
entries: Een knutselmateriaal dat wordt gebruikt om {@item sonic bomb|AGMH}s te maken.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: Als een bonus actie kan de fluiprei tot zijn snelheid bewegen naar een vijandig wezen dat hij kan zien.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) snijschade.
Velociprey have blue scales with black stripes, and a dull red crest on their heads. These carnivorous monsters travel in packs and inhabit many different environments.

Velociprey have highly developed brains, and can come up with a hunting plan quite quickly. The Velociprey will use a range of calls to talk to each other in order to cooperate properly. They usually surround prey, giving it little ways to escape, and attack by using their foot claws and hand claws. If their is a large pack, they can take down prey bigger than young {@creature Aptonoth|MHMM}. Inside of a Velociprey's beak is number of sharp, thin teeth. Though the teeth look delicate, they are surprisingly hard to break. Even bombs can't break a Velociprey's teeth. Velociprey have powerful legs for used running at high speeds after prey with claws used to injure prey.
Velociprey packs are known to raid villages for food and will sometimes raid villages if food is scarce.

items.name: Velociprey Hide
entries: You reduce fire, cold, lightning, and necrotic damage you take by 1 while you wear this armor.

items.name: Velociprey Scale
entries: You have a +1 bonus to {@skill Medicine} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Velociprey Fang
entries: When you cast a spell that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, add 1/2 of your proficiency bonus to that damage.

items.name: Sm Monster Bone
entries: Ongewoon wapen upgrade materiaal.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vespoid doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage. On hit target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the paralysis on itself on a success.

Vespoids are wasp-like insects roughly the size of a housecat. They have barbed stingers at the end of their abdomens, and fly using three pairs of wings. They are known to be a nuisance for adventurers, due to their stingers loaded with a neuro-toxin that can paralyze foes. Vespoid are simple workers to a single large {@creature Vespoid Queen|MHMM}. They come in two varieties. The small worker Vespoid is charged with gathering food, maintaining the hive, and caretaking the queen and her eggs. The large, sturdier soldier vespoids exist for the sole purpose of defending the queen. They will frequently attack any intruders, no matter how large or small. Their stingers don't penetrate the thick shells of most wyverns, but pose a significant deterrent to humans and Fanged Beasts alike.

items.name: Vespoid Shell
entries: {@i Honey Hunter.} Once per day, when you use an {@item herbalism kit|PHB} to gather {@table plants|AGMH}, you gather 1 {@table insects|AGMH|honey} with it.

items.name: Vespoid Shell
entries: While attuned to this weapon your save DC for condition causing effects, such as the {@spell sleep} spell, or a material effect, is increased by 1.

items.name: Vespoid Wing
entries: This weapon has 2 runes, that it regains daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with this weapon you can expend a rune to have the target make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target is {@condition incapacitated} and has its movement speed is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: Ongewoon of zeldzaam opwaarderingsmateriaal dat kan worden gebruikt voor wapens of bepantsering.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vespoid princess doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the vespoid princess can move up to its flying speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage. On hit target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the paralysis on itself on a success.

action.name: Corrosive Spray
entries: The vespoid princess projects corrosive acid at a creature within 15 feet of it. That creature must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target has a nonmagical weapon made of metal, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed.

{@creature Vespoid|MHMM}s are wasp-like insects roughly the size of a housecat. They have barbed stingers at the end of their abdomens, and fly using three pairs of wings. They are known to be a nuisance for adventurers, due to their stingers loaded with a neuro-toxin that can paralyze foes. Vespoid are simple workers to a single large {@creature Vespoid Queen|MHMM}. They come in two varieties. The small worker Vespoid is charged with gathering food, maintaining the hive, and caretaking the queen and her eggs. The large, sturdier soldier vespoids exist for the sole purpose of defending the queen. They will frequently attack any intruders, no matter how large or small. Their stingers don't penetrate the thick shells of most wyverns, but pose a significant deterrent to humans and Fanged Beasts alike.

items.name: PrincessVespoidShl
entries: {@i Entomologist.} Wanneer je een {@table insects|AGMH|insect} vangt met een {@item bug net|AGMH}, vang je er in plaats daarvan twee.

items.name: VespoidPr'sCrown
entries: You know the {@spell acid splash} cantrip while wearing this armor.

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: Ongewoon of zeldzaam opwaarderingsmateriaal dat kan worden gebruikt voor wapens of bepantsering.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vespoid queen doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) poison damage. On hit target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the paralysis on itself on a success.

action.name: Corrosive Gas {@recharge 5}
entries: The Vespoid Queen releases a corrosive gas from her stinger in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If a creature in that area has a nonmagical weapon made of metal, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed

The Vespoid Queen looks similar to the average {@creature Vespoid|MHMM} but is several times larger, with a more pronounced abdomen and giant, rainbow coloured wings. She has a ridged exoskeleton covering her soft innards and she has a crown-like structure atop her head.

Vespoid Queen rarely leave their nests as they send out workers to forage for food. They feed on smaller insects, birds, small mammals, lizards, and some vegetation. Whenever the queen does leave the nest she puts herself in serious danger as she can be preyed upon by creatures such as {@creature Gypceros|MHMM}, {@creature Yian Kut-Ku|MHMM}, {@creature Hypnocatrice|MHMM}, and {@creature Plesioth|MHMM}.

The Vespoid Queen rarely does battle; when it does, it essentially performs the same attacks as Vespoids with more power; however, it does possess an additional attack: it sprays body fluid at hunters that halves defense. It also produces a beating sound in order to command swarm of Vespoid in battle. The queen spends a vast majority of her time staying within the nest and laying eggs.

items.name: Vespoid Abdomen
entries: While you wear this armor, the maximum number of resources your party can gather on a hunt is increased by 1.

items.name: QueenVespoidShl
entries: {@i Entomologist.} Wanneer je een {@table insects|AGMH|insect} vangt met een {@item bug net|AGMH}, vang je er in plaats daarvan twee.

items.name: Vespoid Abdomen
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} You know the {@spell poison spray} cantrip while attuned to this weapon. If you already know it, the DC of the spell increases by 1.

items.name: VespoidQn'sCrown
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon and it is suffering from a condition, it takes an extra 2 damage of the same type dealt.

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: Ongewoon of zeldzaam opwaarderingsmateriaal dat kan worden gebruikt voor wapens of bepantsering.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The vigorwasp explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 5 feet of it regains 4 (1d8) hit points.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: De vigorwasp lokt geen gelegenheidsaanvallen uit als hij buiten het bereik van een vijand vliegt.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The viper tobi-kadachi's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Gliding
entries: The viper tobi-kadachi can glide up to 60 feet instead of moving, when the viper tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the viper tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The viper tobi-kadachi makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Poison Spikes {@recharge 5}
entries: The viper tobi-kadachi spins in a circle at a rapid pace, releasing {@condition poisoned} spikes in a 60-foot cone in front of it. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the poison on a success.

Much like its standard counterpart, the Viper Tobi-Kadachi's face resembles that of a colubrid with its body retaining several of the standard {@creature Tobi-Kadachi|MHMM}'s characteristics such as the slim, squirrel-like body, the fur patches which trail across its back as well as the large, bushy tail armed with spikes.

Its main difference compared to the regular species is obviously the vastly different color scheme consisting of several shades of brown, bronze and burnt orange. Additionally, its belly and underside fade from a more yellowish hue to a pale blue. The eyes of the Viper Tobi-Kadachi are also different in that they have a more golden yellow coloration in comparison to the red eyes of its standard counterpart.

Viper Tobi-Kadachi has an arsenal consisting of powerful status effects. It uses a strong poison in order to attack its opponents which it can generate and utilize via its fangs or the extra spikes on its tail. It can use these spikes as projectiles, allowing the Viper Tobi-Kadachi to poison several opponents at once within a certain range, much like the {@creature Nargacuga|MHMM}'s bleeding-inflicting tail spikes. While it cannot use thunder-based attacks, the Viper Tobi-Kadachi can still paralyze its opponents much like its standard counterpart, giving it a deadly combination of powerful poison and the ability to immobilise opponents. Viper Tobi-Kadachi also retains the membranes between its limbs which allow it to glide around its opponents much like its standard counterpart.

items.name: V.Tobi-Kadachi Thickfur
entries: You can don or doff your armor as an action, while you are attuned to this armor.

items.name: V.Tobi-Kadachi Shard
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Acrobatics} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: V.Deadly Poison Sac
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition poisoned} condition while you wear this armor.

items.name: V.Tobi-Kadachi Membrane
entries: {@i Constitution.} De duur van vertragende effecten, zoals de {@spell slow} spreuk of de ademaanval van een koperen draak, wordt met de helft verminderd terwijl je dit pantser draagt.

items.name: V.Tobi-Kadachi Hardclaw
entries: {@i Airborne.} While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell jump} spell from it as a bonus action at will, but can target only yourself when you do so.

items.name: V.Ultraplegia Sac
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition paralyzed} condition, you do so with advantage.

items.name: V.Tobi-Kadachi Thorn
entries: You are resistant to cold damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: V.Kadachi Gem
entries: {@i Evade Extender (M).} You have a +2 bonus to Dexterity saving throws while you wear this armor.

items.name: V.Tobi-Kadachi Thickfur
entries: {@i Quick Sheath.} Als je op dit wapen bent afgestemd, kun je het altijd als vrije actie wegleggen, zelfs als je al een wapen hebt getrokken als onderdeel van je bewegingsactie.

items.name: V.Tobi-Kadachi Shard
entries: While attuned to this weapon, your spell save DC is increased by 2 when casting spells that paralyzes or poisons a creature.

items.name: V.Deadly Poison Sac
entries: Your poison spells and attacks with this weapon deal an extra 1d4 poison damage.

items.name: Ultraplegia Sac
entries: {@i (Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, & Wizard only)} While attuned to this weapon you can cast the {@spell hold person} spell from it, without expending a spell slot. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: V.Kadachi Gem
entries: When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

items.name: V. Deadly Poison Sac
entries: You can make a {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@item Poisoner's Kit|PHB}) check using this material as its ingredient plus a {@item vial|PHB}. On a success you create a vial of {@item wyvern poison|DMG} (DMG p. 258). On a fail, the material is destroyed. If you fail the save by 5 or more, you must make a saving throw against the wyvern poison.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The viper tobi-kadachi's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Gliding
entries: When the viper tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the viper tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The viper tobi-kadachi makes three attacks: two with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doelwit. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Poison Spikes {@recharge 5}
entries: The viper tobi-kadachi spins in a circle at a rapid pace, releasing {@condition poisoned} spikes in a 15-foot cone in front of it. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the poison on a success.
